#Text=Former Scottish Conservatives leader Annabel Goldie to stand down as MSP
#Text=Friday , June 26 , 2015
#Text=Annabel Goldie , Scottish Conservative Party leader from 2005 to 2011 , has announced she will stand down as an MSP at the next elections in 2016 .

#Text=Goldie , who has been an MSP for the West Scotland ( previously West of Scotland ) electoral region since the Scottish Parliament 's formation in 1999 , said she intends to focus on her role in the House of Lords , where she has been a peer since 2013 .
#Text=File : Annabel Goldie . jpg
#Text=File photo of Annabel Goldie .
#Text=Image : Wsdouglas . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=In a statement today , Goldie said leading the party was an " enormous honour " for her .

#Text= Meanwhile , David Cameron , UK Conservative leader and UK Prime Minister , said : " Annabel is one of those rare breeds in Scottish politics , somebody known by her first name alone .

column1: #Text=When she was Scottish Conservative leader , I valued her sage advice .
#Text=She has been a towering strength to our party in Scotland , a doughty debater in the TV studios and Scottish Parliament and has one of the sharpest wits around .
#Text=I wish her a long and happy retirement after 17 years unstinting service at Holyrood – but look forward to seeing her on the red benches of the Lords for years to come .
#Text="

#Text=This led to Goldie remarking in her inaugural speech in 2005 that :  The wheels are back on the wagon - and I 'm the nag hitched up to tow it .

column1: #Text=The party is still way ahead of where it was in 1997 .
#Text=And my first task is to take it forward to 2007 .
#Text=" However , under Goldie 's leadership , the number of seats the Scottish Conservatives won in the Scottish Parliament slightly decreased from 18 in 2003 to 17 in 2007 and to 15 in 2011 .
